page.title: 16DOGMERSFIELD PARK
page.content: Dogmersfield Park originally formed the private grounds of Dogmersfield House. The house today,however, is in separate ownership with only 27 acres of ground still attached to it.The remainder of the land is put to agricultural use. It is evenly divided between rough, enclosed grazing land and cereal crops. In addition there are several copses and two lakes, presumably part of the original landscaping. The land undulates and the cultivated parts are large areas in the modern style with all old hedgerows removed. There is a right of way running across the Park, but most of it is inaccessible to the public.
